desc.description: Provides a description for this task. Used by the --list/-l flag

summary.description: Provides a summary for this task. Used by the --summary flag

label.description: Override the task name print on summary, can be interpolated with variables

run.description: Controls whether or not this task runs when called by multiple deps or cmds.

cmds.description: A list of commands for this task

dir.description: Defines where the task will run. Defaults to the directory of the Taskfile

deps.description: Declaring tasks here that should run automatically before this task

sources.description: List the source files for this task. Will be used to prevent running the task again if nothing changed. Can be a file of a file pattern.

generates.description: List the files generated by this task. Will be used to prevent running the task again if nothing changed. Can be a file of a file pattern.

status.description: Define a sequence of tests as status of this task. If no error is returned (exit status 0), the task is considered up-to-date

method.description: Defines which method is used to check the task is up-to-date. timestamp will compare the timestamp of the sources and generates files. checksum will check the checksum (You will probably want to ignore the .task folder in your .gitignore file). none skips any validation and always run the task

internal.description: Indicates that the task cannot be called directly by the user

silent.description: Silent mode disables echoing of commands before Task runs it

ignore_error.description: Prevent Task from aborting the execution of tasks even after receiving a status code of 1

prefix.description: Defines a string to prefix the output of tasks running in parallel. Only used when the output mode is prefix

preconditions.description: Defines a list of conditions to be true for the task to run

interactive.description: Indicates that this task runs an interactive CLI application

sh.description: The value will be treated as a command and the output assigned

task.description: Name of the task to run

vars.description: Values passed to the task called

silent.description: Silent mode disables echoing of command before Task runs it

ignore_error.description: Prevent command from aborting the execution of task even after receiving a status code of 1

sh.description: Command to run. If that command returns 1, the condition will fail

msg.description: Failure message to display when the condition fails

version.description: Specify the Taskfile format that this file conforms to.

includes.description: Imports other tasks from the provided taskfile. The tasks described in the given Taskfiles will be available with the informed namespace.

dir.description: On which directory the included Taskfile will run

silent.description: Silent mode disables echoing of commands for all tasks

output.description: Defines how the STDOUT and STDERR are printed when running tasks in parallel. The interleaved output prints lines in real time (default). The group output will print the entire output of a command once, after it finishes, so you wonâ€™t have live feedback for commands that take a long time to run. The prefix output will prefix every line printed by a command with [task-name] as the prefix, but you can customize the prefix for a command with the prefix: attribute.

method.description: Defines which method is used to check the task is up-to-date. (default: checksum)

run.description: Default behavior when tasks are executed as part of deps or other cmds
